Package org.neo4j.internal.kernel.api

Interface Read

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AllStoreHolder, Read, StubRead
    public interface Read
    Defines the graph read operations of the Kernel.

    • Method Detail

      • indexReadSession

        IndexReadSession indexReadSession​(IndexDescriptor index)
                           throws IndexNotFoundKernelException
        Ensure there is an IndexReadSession for the given index bound to this transaction, and return it. Not Thread-safe.
        Parameters:
        index - descriptor for the index to read from
        Returns:
        the IndexReadSession.
        Throws:
        IndexNotFoundKernelException

      • prepareForLabelScans

        void prepareForLabelScans()
        Ensure this transaction is prepared for node label scans. This avoids concurrency issues. Not Thread-safe.

      • nodeIndexSeek

        void nodeIndexSeek​(IndexReadSession index,
                   NodeValueIndexCursor cursor,
                   IndexQueryConstraints constraints,
                   IndexQuery... query)
            throws KernelException
        Seek all nodes matching the provided index query in an index.
        Parameters:
        index - IndexReadSession referencing index to query.
        cursor - the cursor to use for consuming the results.
        constraints - The requested constraints on the query result, such as the IndexOrder, or whether the index should fetch property values together with node ids for index queries. The constraints must be satisfiable given the capabilities of the index.
        query - Combination of index queries to run against referenced index.
        Throws:
        KernelException

      • relationshipIndexSeek

        void relationshipIndexSeek​(IndexDescriptor index,
                           RelationshipIndexCursor cursor,
                           IndexQueryConstraints constraints,
                           IndexQuery... query)
                    throws KernelException
        Seek all relationships matching the provided index query in an index. This is almost but not quite a relationship counterpart to nodeIndexSeek(IndexReadSession, NodeValueIndexCursor, IndexQueryConstraints, IndexQuery...), in that this method currently cannot return values from the index. This may be added in the future. When this happens, this method may be extended with parameters for indexOrder and needsValues, and the cursor parameter will likely require a "value" cursor instead of just an "index" cursor.
        Parameters:
        index - IndexDescriptor for the index to query. This must be an index of relationships.
        cursor - the cursor to use for consuming the results.
        constraints - The requested constraints on the query result, such as the IndexOrder, or whether the index should fetch property values together with relationship ids for index queries. The constraints must be satisfiable given the capabilities of the index.
        query - Combination of index queries to run against referenced index.
        Throws:
        KernelException

      • lockingNodeUniqueIndexSeek

        long lockingNodeUniqueIndexSeek​(IndexDescriptor index,
                                NodeValueIndexCursor cursor,
                                IndexQuery.ExactPredicate... predicates)
                         throws KernelException
        Returns node id of node found in the unique index, or -1 if no node was found. Note that this is a very special method and should be use with caution. It has special locking semantics in order to facilitate unique creation of nodes. If a node is found; a shared lock for the index entry will be held whereas if no node is found we will hold onto an exclusive lock until the close of the transaction. Note: This method does not take an IndexReadSession, as it has to acquire a new index session internally to ensure node uniqueness.
        Parameters:
        index - IndexDescriptor for the index to query.
        cursor - cursor to use for performing the index seek
        predicates - Combination of index queries to run against referenced index.
        Throws:
        KernelException

      • nodeIndexScan

        void nodeIndexScan​(IndexReadSession index,
                   NodeValueIndexCursor cursor,
                   IndexQueryConstraints constraints)
            throws KernelException
        Scan all values in an index.
        Parameters:
        index - IndexReadSession index read session to query.
        cursor - the cursor to use for consuming the results.
        constraints - The requested constraints on the query result, such as the IndexOrder, or whether the index should fetch property values together with node ids for index queries. The constraints must be satisfiable given the capabilities of the index.
        Throws:
        KernelException

        Scan all nodes with a label.
        Parameters:
        label - the label
        cursor - the cursor to use for consuming the results.
        order - the requested order on the query result.

                NodeCursor cursor)

        Checks if a node exists in the database
        Parameters:
        reference - The reference of the node to check
        Returns:
        true if the node exists, otherwise false

      • countsForNode

        long countsForNode​(int labelId)
        The number of nodes in the graph, including anything changed in the transaction state. If the label parameter is TokenRead.ANY_LABEL, this method returns the total number of nodes in the graph, i.e. MATCH (n) RETURN count(n). If the label parameter is set to any other value, this method returns the number of nodes that has that label, i.e. MATCH (n:LBL) RETURN count(n).
        Parameters:
        labelId - the label to get the count for, or TokenRead.ANY_LABEL to get the total number of nodes.
        Returns:
        the number of matching nodes in the graph.

      • countsForNodeWithoutTxState

        long countsForNodeWithoutTxState​(int labelId)
        The number of nodes in the graph, without taking into account anything in the transaction state. If the label parameter is TokenRead.ANY_LABEL, this method returns the total number of nodes in the graph, i.e. MATCH (n) RETURN count(n). If the label parameter is set to any other value, this method returns the number of nodes that has that label, i.e. MATCH (n:LBL) RETURN count(n).
        Parameters:
        labelId - the label to get the count for, or TokenRead.ANY_LABEL to get the total number of nodes.
        Returns:
        the number of matching nodes in the graph.

      • countsForRelationship

        long countsForRelationship​(int startLabelId,
                           int typeId,
                           int endLabelId)
        The number of relationships in the graph, including anything changed in the transaction state. Returns the number of relationships in the graph that matches the specified pattern, (:startLabelId)-[:typeId]->(:endLabelId), like so:
        startLabelIdtypeId endLabelId Pattern
        TokenRead.ANY_LABEL TokenRead.ANY_RELATIONSHIP_TYPE TokenRead.ANY_LABEL MATCH ()-[r]->() RETURN count(r)
        TokenRead.ANY_LABEL REL TokenRead.ANY_LABEL MATCH ()-[r:REL]->() RETURN count(r)
        LHS TokenRead.ANY_RELATIONSHIP_TYPE TokenRead.ANY_LABEL MATCH (:LHS)-[r]->() RETURN count(r)
        TokenRead.ANY_LABEL TokenRead.ANY_RELATIONSHIP_TYPE RHS MATCH ()-[r]->(:RHS) RETURN count(r)
        LHS REL TokenRead.ANY_LABEL MATCH (:LHS)-[r:REL]->() RETURN count(r)
        TokenRead.ANY_LABEL REL RHS MATCH ()-[r:REL]->(:RHS) RETURN count(r)
        Parameters:
        startLabelId - the label of the start node of relationships to get the count for, or TokenRead.ANY_LABEL.
        typeId - the type of relationships to get a count for, or TokenRead.ANY_RELATIONSHIP_TYPE.
        endLabelId - the label of the end node of relationships to get the count for, or TokenRead.ANY_LABEL.
        Returns:
        the number of matching relationships in the graph.

      • countsForRelationshipWithoutTxState

        long countsForRelationshipWithoutTxState​(int startLabelId,
                                         int typeId,
                                         int endLabelId)
        The number of relationships in the graph, without taking into account anything in the transaction state. Returns the number of relationships in the graph that matches the specified pattern, (:startLabelId)-[:typeId]->(:endLabelId), like so:
        startLabelIdtypeId endLabelId Pattern
        TokenRead.ANY_LABEL TokenRead.ANY_RELATIONSHIP_TYPE TokenRead.ANY_LABEL MATCH ()-[r]->() RETURN count(r)
        TokenRead.ANY_LABEL REL TokenRead.ANY_LABEL MATCH ()-[r:REL]->() RETURN count(r)
        LHS TokenRead.ANY_RELATIONSHIP_TYPE TokenRead.ANY_LABEL MATCH (:LHS)-[r]->() RETURN count(r)
        TokenRead.ANY_LABEL TokenRead.ANY_RELATIONSHIP_TYPE RHS MATCH ()-[r]->(:RHS) RETURN count(r)
        LHS REL TokenRead.ANY_LABEL MATCH (:LHS)-[r:REL]->() RETURN count(r)
        TokenRead.ANY_LABEL REL RHS MATCH ()-[r:REL]->(:RHS) RETURN count(r)
        Parameters:
        startLabelId - the label of the start node of relationships to get the count for, or TokenRead.ANY_LABEL.
        typeId - the type of relationships to get a count for, or TokenRead.ANY_RELATIONSHIP_TYPE.
        endLabelId - the label of the end node of relationships to get the count for, or TokenRead.ANY_LABEL.
        Returns:
        the number of matching relationships in the graph.

      • nodesGetCount

        long nodesGetCount()
        Count of the total number of nodes in the database including changes in the current transaction.
        Returns:
        the total number of nodes in the database

      • relationshipsGetCount

        long relationshipsGetCount()
        Count of the total number of relationships in the database including changes in the current transaction.
        Returns:
        the total number of relationships in the database

      • nodePropertyChangeInTransactionOrNull

        Value nodePropertyChangeInTransactionOrNull​(long node,
                                            int propertyKeyId)
        Returns the value of a node property if set in this transaction.
        Parameters:
        node - the node
        propertyKeyId - the property key id of interest
        Returns:
        null if the property has not been changed for the node in this transaction. Otherwise returns the new property value, or Values.NO_VALUE if the property has been removed in this transaction.

      • relationshipPropertyChangeInTransactionOrNull

        Value relationshipPropertyChangeInTransactionOrNull​(long relationship,
                                                    int propertyKeyId)
        Returns the value of a relationship property if set in this transaction.
        Parameters:
        relationship - the relationship
        propertyKeyId - the property key id of interest
        Returns:
        null if the property has not been changed for the relationship in this transaction. Otherwise returns the new property value, or Values.NO_VALUE if the property has been removed in this transaction.

      • transactionStateHasChanges

        boolean transactionStateHasChanges()
        Returns:
        whether there are changes in the transaction state.
